page.title: 13Sceughmire & Woodhouse
page.content: Sceughmire is about 1\ miles E of Great Orton.There are 3 farms.Crops grown in are hay,silage,barley,kale & turnips. Animals include Fresians, Jerseys & Charolais for milk & beef. One farmer breeds Clydesdale horses & exhibits them at local shows. Cheviot, Swaledale, Suffolk and Leicester sheep are also bred. Orton Park is a large house standing in parkland.The mansion originally called Hylton Castle, was erected in 1839 by Sir Walter Brisco. It is now a Council residential home for delinquent boys. Woodhouses, another small hamlet is 1 mile SW of Great Orton & has only 7 houses.Grass & barley are grown. Animals are sold at Carlisle & Wigton auctions.Milk is taken by tanker to a creamery & made into powdered milk & condensed milk.19 people live here.1 family specialises in Cumberland & Westmorland wrestling.
